analysis.Summary: Vue SFC that renders a single product category card with its image, name, edit and delete actions. It optionally supports recursive rendering of sub-categories (commented out).
analysis.Purpose: Serve as a reusable UI block for displaying a category in lists or grids, allowing users to navigate to an edit page or trigger deletion.

Components.name: CardCategory
Components.role: Self-recursive wrapper for rendering child categories (currently commented out).

Components.name: IconEdit
Components.role: Presents a pencil/edit icon inside the edit button/link.

Components.name: IconAdd
Components.role: Imported but not used in this component (potential for future use).

Components.name: IconDelete
Components.role: Renders a trash/delete icon inside the delete button.

Functions.name: deleteCategory
Functions.purpose: Emit a 'delete' event upstream when user clicks the delete button.

Dependencies: FILE_SERVER_URL (global env var for image base URL)
analysis.Usage: Imported into parent components or pages (e.g. a category list) via `import CardCategory from './CardCategory.vue'` and used in templates with `<CardCategory :category="cat" @delete="onDelete" />` or inside a `v-for` loop.
Notes: The recursive rendering of child categories is present but commented out; if enabled, props and events must flow correctly for nested deletions.
The SCSS targets a `.card-title` wrapper that isn't present in the templateâ€”styles may not apply as intended.
IconAdd is imported but unused, indicating either a leftover or preparation for an 'add subcategory' feature.
Navigation to edit page uses route param `_id` from current route and `category.url` for the category identifier.
